meanings.definition: The middle part of the alimentary canal in vertebrates, between the foregut and hindgut.
meanings.sent1: The midgut helps in digesting food in animals.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon focused on the midgut during the operation.
meanings.sent3: The midgut decided to take a break from digesting and went on strike!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the midgut of her success.
meanings.sent5: The midgut, like a diligent worker, processed the nutrients efficiently.

meanings.definition: The middle part of the digestive tract in insects and some other invertebrates.
meanings.sent1: Insects rely on their midgut for breaking down food.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the anatomy of the midgut in insects.
meanings.sent3: The midgut of the insect grumbled loudly after a heavy meal.
meanings.sent4: The midgut of the earthworm was a bustling marketplace of digestion.
meanings.sent5: The midgut of the beetle shimmered under the microscope's light.
